history.content:
Ever wished your Electrical Engineering and Computer Science degree included more electrical engineering and less ML/AI/blockchain? Ready to graduate from breadboards to real electronics engineering?

Printed circuit boards (PCBs) are the building blocks of modern electronics; they can be found in applications ranging from cell phones to medical devices to rockets. The Hands-On PCB Engineering (HOPE) DeCal teaches students effective PCB design and empowers them to create custom electronics for classes, personal projects, student teams, and more.

Students learn effective system, schematic, and layout design for PCBs through
hands-on applications, and experience basic PCB assembly and bringup. Students
will be exposed to some advanced PCB design topics such as DFT, DFM, signal
and power integrity, grounding, thermals, and isolation.

Check out our DeCal listing for more info on course format, time, etc.: https://decal.berkeley.edu/courses/6020
Get a Permission Number to enroll by filling out this form: https://forms.gle/QuLNdmXqone7BhLE8
